statements: SELECT * FROM customers
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers
SELECT customer_id, email FROM customers WHERE first_name = 'John'
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE last_name LIKE '%son%'
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001'
SELECT first_name, last_name FROM customers WHERE email = 'john.doe@example.com'
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE phone_number LIKE '%1234'
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM customers ORDER BY last_name DESC, first_name ASC
SELECT customer_id, email FROM customers WHERE first_name = 'Alice'
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_address, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_address = '123 Main St';
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT customer_name, order_date, total_amount FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email, customer_address FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE '%Smith%' AND customer_address IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM orders JOIN customers ON orders.customer_id = customers.customer_id WHERE total_amount > 1000 ORDER BY order_id ASC;
SELECT customer_name, COUNT(order_id) AS num_orders FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id GROUP BY customer_name HAVING num_orders > 3;
